src:
Družinsko šampionsko slavje
Maverick Viñales dobil dirko v razredu motoGP na VN Malezije. Stari novi svetovni prvak Marc Marquez si je privozil drugo mesto.
04 Nov 2019, 09:54 by Marko Uršič
SEPANG – Španec Maverick Viñales (Yamaha) je zmagal na veliki nagradi Malezije v motociklizmu v kraljevem razredu motoGP. Drugi je bil na dirkališču v Sepangu njegov rojak Marc Marquez (Honda), ki je že pred to dirko osvojil naslov svetovnega prvaka, njegov mlajši brat Alex Marquez je po drugem mestu v Maleziji predčasno postal prvak v razredu moto2.Šestindvajsetletni Marquez je tako vpisal novih 20 točk in postavil nov rekord, 395 točk, kot jih ima trenutno na prvem mestu, ni zbral v eni sezoni še noben motociklist v zgodovini SP. Do 383 točk je Španec Jorge Lorenzo prišel leta 2010. Tretji v razredu motoGP v Maleziji je bil Italijan Andrea Dovizisoo (Ducati), drugi v skupnem seštevku po predzadnji dirki sezone SP. V ospredju sta svojo dirko peljala Viñales, tretji v SP, in Marquez, ob tem da se je prvi zelo hitro nekoliko oddaljil ter na koncu za dobre tri sekunde prehitel novega starega prvaka. Ta si je šesti naslov privozil že prejšnji mesec, zaradi padca v sobotnih kvalifikacijah pa je to dirko začel šele z 11. mesta. »Z Viñalesom sva zelo dobro startala. Potem sem malce izgubljal oprijem na gumah in zaostal.Preveč časa sem se zadržal tudi za Avstralcem Jackom Millerjem, kjer je Viñales še nekaj pridobil,« je povedal Marquez in se veselil tudi bratovega dosežka. Alex Marquez, voznik ekipe Kalex, je v Sepangu za 0,758 sekunde zaostal za zmagovalcem, Južnoafričanom Bradom Binderjem, in ima dirko pred koncem SP 262 točk ter s tem neulovljivo prednost. Binder (KTM) jih ima 234, tretji v seštevku je Švicar Thomas Lüthi (Kalex, 230), ki je bil tretji tudi na VN Malezije.»Moje sanje so se uresničile,« je dejal Alex Marquez. Italijan Lorenzo Dalla Porta (Honda) je slavil v najšibkejšem razredu moto3, kjer je že pred tem osvojil naslov svetovnega prvaka. Bil je 0,410 sekunde pred Špancem Sergiom Garcio (Honda), tretji je bil drugi Španec Jaume Masia (KTM, +0,803). Dalla Porta je v točkovanju SP zbral 279 točk, drugi je Španec Aron Canet (KTM, 190), tretji pa Italijan Tony Arbolino (Honda) s 175 točkami.V soboto v uvodnem krogu dirke talentov se je po padcu na tleh znašlo več motoristov. Najhuje jo je skupil 20-letni domači dirkač Afridza Munandar: s helikopterjem so ga odpeljali v bolnišnico, a je kmalu zaradi poškodb umrl. Za življenje se v bolnišnici v Kuala Lumpurju bori tudi Japonec Šindži Ogo. Zadnja dirka sezone SP bo 17. novembra, ko bo na programu VN Valencie.
text:
Family Championship Celebration
Maverick Viñales wins motoGP race at the GP of Malaysia. Old New World Champion Marc Marquez earned second place.
04 Nov 2019, 09:54 by Marko Ursic
SEPANG - Spaniard Maverick Viñales (Yamaha) wins the Malaysia Motorcycle Grand Prix in the royal motoGP class. Second in the Sepang race was his cousin Marc Marquez (Honda), who had won the world championship before that race, his younger brother Alex Marquez was second in Malaysia prematurely in moto2. 20 points and set a new record, 395 points as he currently has the number one spot, not collected in a single season by any rider in SP history. Spain's Jorge Lorenzo reached 383 points in 2010. Third in the motoGP class in Malaysia was Italian Andrea Dovizisoo (Ducati), second in the overall standings after the penultimate race of the SP season. In the forefront, Viñales, third in the World Championships, and Marquez took their race, with the first one moving away a bit and eventually overtaking the new old champion by a good three seconds. He made his sixth title last month, and only started 11th because of a fall in Saturday's qualifiers. “We started very well with Viñales. Then I lost a bit of tire grip and fell behind. For too long, I also stayed behind Australia's Jack Miller, where Viñales gained some more, "said Marquez, looking forward to his brother's achievement. Alex Marquez, the driver of the Kalex team, was 0.758 seconds behind the winner, South African Brad Binder, and had a 262-point race ahead of the SP and thus an elusive advantage. Binder (KTM) has 234, Switzerland's Thomas Lüthi (Kalex, 230), third in the Malaysian GP. "My dream came true," said Alex Marquez. Italian Lorenzo Dalla Porta (Honda) celebrated in the weakest moto3 class, where he had previously won the world title. He was 0.410 seconds ahead of Spaniard Sergio Garcio (Honda), third was Spaniard Jaume Masia (KTM, +0.803). Dalla Porta scored 279 points in the World Championships, Spain's Aaron Canet (KTM, 190) and Italy's Tony Arbolino (Honda) with 175 points. Saturday, several motorcyclists found themselves in the opening round of the talent race. It was worst hit by 20-year-old home runner Afridza Munandar: he was taken to a hospital by helicopter but died shortly after being injured. A Japanese man, Shinji Ogo, is also fighting for his life at a hospital in Kuala Lumpur. The last race of the SP season will be on November 17, when it will be on the VN Valencia program.
